com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection

Interface IFifoFileQueue

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FifoFileQueue

    public interface IFifoFileQueue
    FIFO file based queue interface.

    Classes implementing this interface provide a means of communication between components via the underlying (shared) file system. The communications mechanism is a FIFO queue (if message A is enqueued before message B then message A will be dequeued before message B). In this context a message is anything which can be represented as a byte array.

    The underlying queue must be open(java.lang.String, byte, long, long)ed before being used. A component may choose to open a queue as a reader ( MODE_READ), a writer (MODE_WRITE), or both (MODE_READ_WRITE).

    A typical queue reader would use this interface as follows: 

     IFifoFileQueue queue;
 queue.open("/path/to/queue", IFifoFileQueue.MODE_READ);
 IFifoFileQueue.Entry entry = queue.get();
 queue.markAsRead(entry);
 BytesSegment bytes = entry.getBytes();
 // Process bytes.
 queue.remove(entry);
 queue.close();
    A typical queue writer would use use this interface as follows: 
     IFifoFileQueue queue;
 queue.open("/path/to/queue", IFifoFileQueue.MODE_WRITE);
 BytesSegment bytes = ...;
 queue.put(bytes);
 queue.close();
    Some implementations may provide additional flexibility regarding the underlying message sequencing and polling interval (for queue readers). The open(String, byte, long, long) variant allows specification of both.
    See Also:
    IFifoFileQueue.Entry, BytesSegment

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open(String path,
          byte mode,
          long minSeqNum,
          long pollingInterval)
   throws IOException
        Open the queue for reading and/or writing.
        Parameters:
        path - The queue base directory path. If this path does not exist it is created.
        mode - The required access mode.
        minSeqNum - The minimum file sequence number. This may be ignored by some implementations, otherwise it is used to initialise the minimum sequence number in the underlying queuing mechanism to start reading or writing.
        pollingInterval - The queue read pollingInterval. This may be ignored by some implementations, otherwise it is used as the polling interval when reading from the underlying queue.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with underlying file system.

      • open

        void open(String path,
          byte mode)
   throws IOException
        Open the queue for reading and/or writing with default minimum sequence number and polling interval.

        The default values (if meaningful) are defined by the implementing subclass.

        Parameters:
        path - The queue path.
        mode - The required access mode.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with the underlying file system.

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Return whether this queue is currently open or not.
        Returns:
        True if the queue is currently open, false otherwise.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the queue.

        This does not modify the contents of the queue. Any threads blocked on get() are unblocked by this call.

      • get

        IFifoFileQueue.Entry get()
                  throws IOException,
                         InterruptedException
        Get the contents of the first entry on the queue without removing it from the queue.

        This call blocks until an entry is placed on the queue or until it is otherwise interrupted.

        It is the caller's responsibility to call remove(com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.IFifoFileQueue.Entry) once the entry is processed in order to remove it from the queue. Failure to do this results on successive calls returning the same bytes.

        The caller may optionally choose to mark the returned entry as read in case there is an error while processing it.

        Returns:
        The first entry on the queue, or null if the queue is closed or not open for reading.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with underlying file system.
        InterruptedException - If interrupted before an entry is placed on the queue.
        See Also:
        markAsRead(com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.IFifoFileQueue.Entry)

      • get

        IFifoFileQueue.Entry get(long timeout)
                  throws IOException,
                         InterruptedException,
                         TimeoutException
        Get the contents of the first entry on the queue without removing it from the queue.

        This call blocks until an entry is placed on the queue or until it is otherwise interrupted.

        It is the caller's responsibility to call remove(com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.IFifoFileQueue.Entry) once the entry is processed in order to remove it from the queue. Failure to do this results on successive calls returning the same bytes.

        The caller may optionally choose to mark the returned entry as read in case there is an error while processing it.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the time in milliseconds to wait for the contents of the first entry.
        Returns:
        The first entry on the queue, or null if the queue is closed or not open for reading.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with underlying file system.
        InterruptedException - If interrupted before an entry is placed on the queue.
        TimeoutException - if the specified timeout elapses
        See Also:
        markAsRead(com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.IFifoFileQueue.Entry)

      • markAsRead

        boolean markAsRead(IFifoFileQueue.Entry entry)
            throws IOException
        Mark the specified entry as read.

        Once marked as read, IFifoFileQueue.Entry.isMarkedAsRead() returns true on subsequent calls to get(). The caller may use this to perform any required duplicate processing checks.

        Implementing subclasses must guarantee to preserve this marked state across restarts.

        Note that entries need not be marked as read; they may still be removed without being in the read state.

        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to mark.
        Returns:
        True if successfully marked as read, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with the underlying file system.

      • remove

        boolean remove(IFifoFileQueue.Entry entry)
        throws IOException
        Remove the specified entry from the queue.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to remove.
        Returns:
        True if the entry is removed, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with the underlying file system.

      • put

        boolean put(BytesSegment buf)
     throws IOException
        Put an entry at the end of the queue.

        This method guarantees that either the entire entry is placed on the queue or none of it is. This is, entries on the queue are guaranteed to contain the entire contents of the supplied buffer, or none of it.

        Parameters:
        buf - The contents of the new entry.
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error with the underlying file system.
